content:
TITLE: Cloning, Building, and Running MariaDB KB Crawler (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to clone the MariaDB KB crawler repository, build the project using Cargo, and run the crawler with verbose output and force flag. This assumes Rust and Cargo are already installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/crawler/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/Icerath/mariadb_kb_crawler
cd mariadb_kb_crawler

cargo build --release

./target/release/mariadb_kb_crawler(.exe) --force --verbose
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Help Contents into MariaDB
DESCRIPTION: Command to import the generated help contents SQL file into MariaDB using the mysql command-line client.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/help_contents/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
mysql -u root -p mysql < [filepath]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building MariaDB KB Server in Rust
DESCRIPTION: Command to build the MariaDB KB Server binary using Cargo, Rust's package manager and build system. This command compiles the project in release mode for optimal performance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/server/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
cargo build --release
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Virtual Environment for MariaDB PDF Tool on Linux
DESCRIPTION: Commands to set up a Python virtual environment and install the required dependencies for the MariaDB PDF tool on Linux systems. This isolates the project dependencies from the system Python installation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/mariadb_pdf/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
virtualenv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Help Contents for Multiple MariaDB Versions
DESCRIPTION: Example command showing how to generate help contents for MariaDB versions 10.10 and 10.11 using the Python script.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/help_contents/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
python main.py -v 1010 1011
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running MariaDB KB Server Binary
DESCRIPTION: Command to execute the compiled MariaDB KB Server binary. The exact command may vary depending on the operating system (Windows uses .exe extension).
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/server/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
./target/release/mariadb_kb_server(.exe)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Python Virtual Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create and activate a Python virtual environment and install required dependencies using virtualenv.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/help_contents/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
virtualenv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Python Dependencies for MariaDB Documentation
DESCRIPTION: A list of required Python package dependencies for the MariaDB documentation project. These packages are used for web scraping (bs4), PDF generation (pdfkit), HTTP requests (requests), and configuration file parsing (toml).
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/mariadb_pdf/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
bs4
pdfkit
requests
toml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Python Web Scraping Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: A list of Python packages commonly used for web scraping. Beautiful Soup (bs4) is used for parsing HTML, lxml provides XML and HTML parsing capabilities, and requests is used for making HTTP requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/help_contents/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
bs4
lxml
requests
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying MariaDB KB Server Help
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the MariaDB KB Server with the --help flag, which prints usage information and available options for the server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/server/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
./target/release/mariadb_kb_server(.exe) --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Directory for MariaDB KB Crawler (Bash)
DESCRIPTION: Commands to create a new directory for the MariaDB KB crawler project and navigate into it. This step is optional but helps organize the project files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/crawler/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
mkdir mariadb_kb
cd mariadb_kb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Output File Paths Example
DESCRIPTION: Shows the expected output file paths where the generated SQL files will be saved.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/help_contents/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
./output/fill_help_contents-1010.sql
./output/fill_help_contents-1011.sql
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying URL Check Badge in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: GitHub Actions workflow badge showing the status of URL checks in the documentation. Uses markdown syntax to embed a status badge that links to the workflow results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mariadb/mariadb-documentation/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
[![URL check](https://github.com/MariaDB/mariadb-documentation/actions/workflows/check_urls.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/MariaDB/mariadb-documentation/actions/workflows/check_urls.yml)
```
